element.name: Fairy
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: Infused with the magic of the Feywild, fairies are a wee folk, but not nearly as much so as their pixie and sprite friends. Most fairies look like small elves with insectile wings, but each has a unique characteristic that sets them apart.

element.name: Fairy
element.source: Mordenkainen Presents: Monsters of the Multiverse

description.p: Infused with the magic of the Feywild, fairies are a wee folk, but not nearly as much so as their pixie and sprite friends. Most fairies look like small elves with insectile wings, but each has a unique characteristic that sets them apart.

You know the Druidcraft cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the Enlarge/Reduce spell with this trait. Once you cast Faerie Fire or Enlarge/Reduce with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is the ability increased by this race's Ability Score Increase trait.
Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can't use this flying speed if you're wearing medium or heavy armor.
